title: Ethiopia sets target of 7 billion US dollars in revenues from tourism by 2020Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Ethiopia sets target of 7 billion US dollars in revenues from tourism by 2020 Published on : Monday, August 17, 2015
Ethiopia has set a target to secure seven billion US dollars in revenues from tourism by the end of the second five-year Growth and Transformation Plan (GTP) period in 2020, says Tourism minister Amin Abdulkadir.
The plan is to increase the revenue which the nation collects from foreign tourists by threefold from the level achieved at the end of the first GTP, in the just concluded Ethiopian fiscal year, he added in Bahir Dar last week.
The country had secured two billion USD from 700,000 foreign tourists who visited tourist destinations in the country at the end of the first GTP period.
Opening new destination for tourists, expanding infrastructure networks and promoting tourist destinations are among the things to be done in order to meet the target, he said.
Amin added that the government has taken a lesson over the past five years that tourism can be a huge source of revenue for the nation and a major instrument to eradicate poverty.
Regarding job creation, the sector is expected to create half a million additional jobs at the end of the 2nd GTP period. Currently, tourism employs 700,000 people.
The nation is expected to finish most of the work to achieve its vision of becoming one of the top five tourist destination countries in Africa during the next five years, he added.
